name: Grand Cititel Hanoi Hotel & Spa
detail: Everything is excellent here. Grand Cititel Hanoi Hotel is located within Old Quarter area, convenience store (Circle K) is just at corner of the street & about 10-15 mins walk to Hoan Kiem Lake. Hotel staffs are all friendly & helpful especially the female receptionist who checked me in. Appreciate for the complimentary cocktails they offered to celebrate anniversary with my boyfriend. My room is situated at level 8 (considered high floor in this hotel), not very nice view but very clean, provided with every amenities I need & the bed is really comfortable to rest on. International buffet served for complimentary breakfast, including of salad, fruit, sweet yogurt, bun, ham, cheese, porridge with condiments, rice with dishes, egg station & pho noodle station. Only 3 star for their facilities due to there’s no swimming pool, gym & spa in the hotel. The only unpleasant part is housekeeping attendant ring my door early at 8am on the 4th day just to ask if I need laundry service.
area: Hoan Kiem District,Hanoi - View on map

name: Kecho Legacy Hotel & Spa
detail: Premier king room, very nice feel, spacious, nice outlook.

name: Grand Plaza Hotel Hanoi
detail: compared to hanoi daewoo or hanoi hotel, the rooms are very clean and service is outstanding. i will use it again next time as being very satisfied with it. compared to hanoi daewoo or hanoi hotel, the rooms are very clean and service is outstanding. i will use it again next time as being very satisfied with it. compared to hanoi daewoo or hanoi hotel, the rooms are very clean and service is outstanding. i will use it again next time as being very satisfied with it. compared to hanoi daewoo or hanoi hotel, the rooms are very clean and service is outstanding. i will use it again next time as being very satisfied with it.

name: Lotte Hotel Hanoi
detail: My experience with Lotte Hotel Hanoi has been nothing short of perfect ever since I made the decision to book a room. Everyone at the hotel seems to go out of their way to make your special occasion even better. As soon as I got to the hotel I was blown away by the view. It's one thing to imagine it but it's another thing altogether to get, what is perhaps, the best view in Hanoi from what might be the most luxurious hotel in Hanoi. The service is absolutely impeccable from everyone in the hotel but I do need to specially point out Ms. Ngan, Mr. Dat Tan Nguyen and every one of the Reservation Sales Agents I talked to for doing an exceptional job. They go out of their way to ensure you have the best time possible.

name: Roygent Parks Hanoi
detail: The hotel is very very good. Cater mostly for Japanese customer, you can expect they have their room to the best of quality. The only down-side it that it seem to be far from many things like restaurants or a park to scroll along, or those little lakes that dot Hanoi. All in, good.

name: Signature by M Village Thợ Nhuộm
detail: It was a perfect stay for me and I would highly recommend.
area: Hoan Kiem District,Hanoi - View on map

name: Grand Vista Hanoi
detail: Rooms are spacious and brand new. Breakfast was standard, was surprised only black coffee was offered for the buffet

name: Hanoi Daewoo Hotel
detail: Given my first time iN Vietnam, I was worried about the cleanliness of the hotels. So I booked in Sheraton Hanoi for 2 days and then moved around the countries and when decided to fly back to Hanoi I was searching for another 5 star hotel since Sheraton was fully booked on that day and I found few 5 star hotels like Lotte and sofitel but but I found that Hanoi daewoo hotel is a five star hotel with a very good price and close to the biggest mall in Hanoi so decided to give it a try and to be frank it has exceeded my expectation

name: Little Charm Hanoi Hostel
detail: I was so lucky to have found Little Charm Hanoi Hostel. I almost booked a different hostel, until I stumbled upon this on Agoda! It's one of the best hostels I've stayed at in my 7 months of continuous traveling. The first hostel where beds are made for you daily and towels can be changed daily if you wish. Lots of toilets and shower rooms on every floor so you won't have to queue. Everyone in the staff was GENUINELY NICE. Zoe on the front desk was always helpful and Antonio the Spanish-speaking vietnamese staff. Guy who checked me in was so nice as well, but I didn't get his name. Breakfast was amaaaazing. I did not expect it to be so good. You are given lots of options on a menu card, but on top of that, there's even a buffet spread for fruits, vegetables and drinks (juices, vietnamese coffee, tea, water). Not only that, the hostel even has a pool with jets! The common area is also nice. You get a quiet work area on the second floor, or you can hang out at the restaurant as all their seats are comfy and all areas are work-conducive. So handy when you're working while traveling like me. It was so good, we extended 2 more nights (direct at the hostel) and we booked again for when we come back to Hanoi. Also, the hostel holds your luggages for you (in a storage room with bag tags) if you want to check out and go to Sapa/Halong Bay for a couple of days. Really can't ask for more! If you don't stay here when you're in Hanoi, you'd be missing out on a lot! Hanoi is chaotic but this hostel is your little oasis in the middle of all that! The best!

name: The Oriental Jade Hotel
detail: Perfectly situated in the Hanoi old quarter. This is a smaller sized hotel with a more personal touch. It has spotless rooms and extremely helpful staff. The rooftop pool is very pleasant especially in the evening. Breakfast is of the best standard. We also received a fruit bowl each day. The only negative I can think of is the rooftop bar prices are a bit pricy. I would certainly stay there again.
area: Hoan Kiem District,Hanoi - View on map
